pronunciation: SANC'TIFY, [Low Latin sanctifico; from sanctus, holy, and facio, to make.]

definitions.text:
1. In general sense, cleanse, purify or holy.
2. To separate, set apart or appoint sacred or religious use.
God blessed the seventh day sanctified it. Genesis 2:3.
So under the Jewish dispensation, sanctify the altar, the temple, the priests, etc.
3. To purify; prepare for divine service, for partaking of things. Exodus 19:10.
4. To separate, ordain appoint the work of redemption the government of the church. John 10:36.
5. To cleanse corruption; purify sin; by detaching the affections the world its defilements, exalting them supreme love God.
Sanctify them through thy truth; thy word is truth.
John 17:17. Ephesians 5:26.
6. To the means of holiness; render productive of holiness or piety.
Those judgments of God are the more welcome, as means which his mercy hath sanctified so me, as me repent of that unjust act.
7. To free guilt.
That man amaz'd what he saw, made haste sanctify the bliss by law.
8. To secure violation.
Truth guards the poet, sanctifies the line.
To sanctify God, praise celebrate him as being; acknowledge honor his majesty, reverence his character laws. Isaiah 8:13.
God sanctifies himself or his name, by vindicating his honor the reproaches of the wicked, manifesting his glory. Ezekiel 36:23.
